# Chord: Diminished 7th in B (Shape: C)

## Description
The Diminished 7th chord in B, represented by the C shape on the guitar, is formed by combining the notes B, D, F, and Ab. This chord has a dissonant and tense quality due to the stacked minor 3rd intervals within it. It is a commonly used chord in jazz and classical music, adding a sense of tension that can lead to resolution.

## Notes and Intervals
- B (root)
- D (minor 3rd)
- F (diminished 5th)
- Ab (diminished 7th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Diminished 7th chord in B (C shape) is often used in jazz, classical, and even some metal music. It has a mysterious and edgy quality that can create tension and drama in a musical composition. When used judiciously, it can add depth and complexity to chord progressions.

## Songs
Here are three songs that feature the Diminished 7th chord in B (C shape):
1. **"Caravan" by Duke Ellington:** This jazz standard prominently features Diminished 7th chords, creating a sense of rhythmic drive and harmonic tension.
2. **"Flight of the Bumblebee" by Nikolai Rimsky-Korsakov:** This classical piece uses Diminished 7th chords to heighten the frenetic energy and virtuosity of the music.
3. **"Dance of Death" by Iron Maiden:** In this metal song, the Diminished 7th chord adds a dark and menacing atmosphere to the music.
